snippet.title: Learn to skate in 10 FUN steps - KIDS Inline skating
snippet.description:
Kids are the future! So at Powerslide, we wanted to create a video for the next generation of inline skaters, making sure their first steps in their new Powerslide skates are safe, correct, and most of all fun.

With these 10 key points it's possible to begin inline skating with the correct material and the correct technique. Multiple speed skating world champion and professional inlineskating instructor Scott Arlidge goes through the essential parts on how to learn skating step by step. " young kids follow his tips and learn a lot how to skate in just a few hours.
Starting from the very basics in skating to slightly more advanced exercises, you will be able to to gain more fun and the ability to skate for longer and better. https://www.powerslide.com/inline/kids-skates/
Video by Mark Heuss: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtgU-Jv6l9O0P2aZuEfJb6A

0:14 Before you start
0:57 Exercises
4:01 Special techniques
4:40 Summary

snippet.title: Kids vocabulary - Where?(in, on, under) - Learn English for kids - English educational video
snippet.description:
http://www.youtube.com/user/EnglishSingsing9
Kids vocabulary - Where?(in, on, under) - Learn English for kids - English educational video

This "Kids Vocabulary" category has been grouped thematically. 
We hope you enjoy studying with our channel videos.
Have fun and subscribe to our channel. Then, you can find some more various English educational animation videos.

★ Subscribe us on YouTube: http://goo.gl/gDa963



--- Title: Where?(in, on, under)  ---

I'm going to have a picnic!

Where is my hat?
It’s under the chair! 
under

Where are my glasses?
They are on the desk! 
on

Where is my jacket?
It’s in the closet! 
in

Where are my socks?
They are behind the ball! 
behind

Where is my bag?
It’s in front of the computer! 
in front of

Where is my sketchbook?
It’s between the dolls! 
between

Where are my colored pencils?
They are beside the book! 
beside

I found everything!
Let’s go have our picnic!

Thanks for checking out the "English Singsing".
© Amanta Inc.

snippet.title: Boom Chicka Boom 🐰 Easter Songs for Kids 🐰 Best Kids Songs 🐰 The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Boom Chicka Boom Easter Songs for Kids, Camp Song, Dance & Action song for Kids: #1 Best kids songs for children! Your kids will enjoy our popular Boom Chicka Boom Easter dance song for kids with lyrics,  Boom Chicka Boom Easter is available in single song download: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/boomchickaboomeaster.aspx
Boom Chicka Boom - Easter Song for Kids
by The Learning Station®                                                               
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station (All rights reserved.)
LYRICS:
(This is a repeat after me song. So make sure your repeat the action & words)
Boom Chicka Boom / Easter
(This is a repeat after me song. So make sure your repeat the action & words)
I said A Boom Chicka Boom! (I said A Boom Chicka Boom!)
Hey Easter Bunny Chicka Boom! (Hey Bunny Chicka Boom!)
Happy Easter Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom! 
(Happy Easter Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom!)
UH-HUH (UH-HUH) OH-YEAH (OH-YEAH) 
One more time. (One more time.) Bunny hop style!

Let’s bunny hop Chicka Boom! (Let’s bunny hop Chicka Boom!)
Let’s bunny hop Chicka Boom! (Let’s bunny hop Chicka Boom!)
Let’s bunny hop Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom! 
(Let’s bunny hop Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom!)
UH-HUH (UH-HUH) OH-YEAH (OH-YEAH) 
One more time. (One more time.) Flop yours ears style!

Let’s flop our ears Chicka Boom! (Let’s shake a hand Chicka Boom!)
Let’s flop our ears Chicka Boom! (Let’s shake a hand Chicka Boom!)
Let’s flop our ears Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom! 
(Let’s flop our ears Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom!)
UH-HUH (UH-HUH) OH-YEAH (OH-YEAH) 
One more time. (One more time.) Wiggle nose style!

Wiggle your nose Chicka Boom! (Wiggle your nose Chicka Boom!)
Wiggle your nose Chicka Boom! (Let’s give a hug Chicka Boom!)
Wiggle you nose Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom!
(Wiggle you nose Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom!)
UH-HUH (UH-HUH) OH-YEAH (OH-YEAH) 
One more time. (One more time.) Shake your tail style!

Shake your tail Chicka Boom! (Shake your shake tail Chicka Boom!)
Shake your tail Chicka Boom! (Shake your shake tail Chicka Boom!)
Shake your tail Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom!
(Shake your tail Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom!)
UH-HUH (UH-HUH) OH-YEAH (OH-YEAH) 
One more time. (One more time.) Bunny pose style!

Bunny Pose Chicka Boom! (Bunny Pose Chicka Boom!)
Bunny Pose Chicka Boom! (Bunny Pose Chicka Boom!)
Bunny Pose Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom! 
(Bunny Pose  Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom!)
UH-HUH (UH-HUH) OH-YEAH (OH-YEAH) 
One more time. (One more time.) Crunch a carrot style!

(Sing with crunchy voice)
Crunch a carrot Chicka Boom! (Crunch a carrot Chicka Boom!)
Crunch a carrot Chicka Boom! (Crunch a carrot Chicka Boom!)
Crunch a carrot Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom! 
(Crunch a carrot Chicka Rocka Chicka Rocka Chicka Boom!)
UH-HUH (UH-HUH) OH-YEAH (OH-YEAH) 
One more time. (One more time.) Wait this carrot is so crunchy and sweet! I’m excited!! Now I know why bunnies hop! (Sing with crunchy voice)

♫ Sabrina Abu-Obeid of TeraBrite & Terabrite Games, Background vocals and recording. 

Boom Chicka Boom Easter song for children is a great brain break, action, camp and dance for children. It makes it easy and fun to take a quick energy brain break in the classroom. This Easter brain breaks, action, camp, dance song is perfect for the preschool, kindergarten and elementary children. It’s ideal for your children’s theme on Easter. Lyrics are included for early readers, EFL programs for children and EFL programs for children.

snippet.title: Learn Colors for Kids & Toddlers Video
snippet.description:
SchoolMyKid created this fun video for kids. Kids, toddlers, and students of any age can learn their colors through this visual and audio teaching tool. Watch and listen to colorful objects being displayed as the type of color is shown. Learning video to teach babies, toddlers, kids, and people of all ages their colors. See and hear about colors through this digital book that includes photos of real-life objects. Learning colors is one of the first steps to school readiness in making sure kids are ready for preschool and kindergarten. This educational video can also be used as a tool to help second language students learn English. 
School My Kid 
schoolmykid 
www.schoolmykid.org 
Learn Colors for Kids & Toddlers Video

snippet.title: Right Here | Parts of the Body Song for Kids | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Right Here by Jack Hartmann is a parts of the body song to get preschool children moving and identifying their body parts.  This video will engage children in active learning as they participate and identify each body part Jack asks them to identify.
This body parts song really encourages children to move and sing-a-long as they reply, "Right Here" when they answer my question  where each body part is and point to the appropriate parts of the body in this body parts for kids song. Come sing along and learn your body parts as you sing Right Here Jack Hartmann.

Lyrics
Girls and boys, I'm Jack Hartmann
Sing along with me and let's learn all different parts of our body
When I ask you where a part of your body is
You point to it and shake it, wiggle it, twist it or move it
Any way you want
And sing out
Right here!
Sing and move
Where is your hair ?
It's right here
Where are your ears
They're right here
Where are your eyes
They're right here
Where is your nose ?
It's right here
Where is your mouth?
It's right here
Where is your chin ?
It's right here
Where is your neck?
It's right here
Where are your shoulders?
They're right here
Right here are my two wrists
I can cross them and twist them like this
Right here are my strong muscles
Pump them up sisters and brothers
Where are your arms ?
They're right here
Where are your elbows?
They're right here
Where are your hands?
They're right here
Where are your fingers
They're right here
Where is your waist ?
It's right here
Where are your hips?
They're right here
Where are your knees?
They're right here
Where are your feet?
They're right here

Right here are my two wrists
I can cross them and twist them like this
Right here are my strong muscles
Pump them up sisters and brothers

Where is your smile?
It's right here

Help support us on Patreon!
https://www.patreon.com/jackhartmann

**************************************************************

Nursery rhymes / baby songs / kids songs accelerate phonemic awareness improving children's word comprehension, reading and writing skills. Rhymes for children with actions teach children basic skills; boosts memory, listening skills and ability to follow directions. This song is great for brain breaks, indoor recess and literacy awareness. Toddlers, preschoolers and kindergarten aged children will laugh with joy as they participate in this super simple, easy to learn, nursery rhyme song that makes learning fun and exciting. Also great for esl and efl. 

Little Treehouse is a one stop shop for preschoolers to engage in a fun 3D animated learning experience with our little treehouse inhabitants, whom we adoringly call Treebies. The main focus of this channel is to help teach your little ones about the basics:

7. Lullabies

snippet.title: Letter Q Song ♫ Phonics Songs for Kids ♫ Learn the Alphabet ♫ Kids Songs by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
The Letter Q Song and Phonics Song for Kids! In this letter sound and phonics song for kids The Learning Station gives the letter sound then asks the children to make that sound. Letter Q, Phonics Songs for Children: Sing and learn the alphabet letters with The Learning Station.  Let’s learn about letters in the alphabet and phonics with the Letter Q song video for kids. Your kids will sing, dance and learn as they explore the alphabet, how to make a letter Q (upper and lower case letters), sound out the letter Q (phonics for kids) and some words starting with the letter Q; Quarter, Quail, Queen, and Quilt! Letter Q song is geared towards toddlers, preschoolers and kindergarten age kids. “Letter Q Song: Download Letter P here: (Only $0.99): https://store.learningstationmusic.com/letterq.aspx

Letter Q Song (Phonics & ABC’s Songs for Kids)
by The Learning Station®  (a.k.a. Learning Station)                                                             
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station (All rights reserved.)
LYRICS:
Letter Q
Let’s learn about a letter in the alphabet. 
It’s so much fun. Let’s learn about one, letter Q, letter Q, letter Q.
Let’s write that letter in the alphabet. It’s so much fun to draw one.
Hold your pointer finger here. Draw the letter in the air.
Follow me, and you’ll see an uppercase Q, an uppercase Q.
That’s an uppercase Q. That’s an uppercase Q.
Now a lowercase Q, a lowercase Q.
That’s a lowercase Q. That’s a lowercase Q.
Now use your voice. Let’s make the sound of the letter Q.
Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq,  Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq (All together now)
Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq,  Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq 
Now use your eyes to see some words that begin with the letter Q.
Quarter Quail Queen Quilt
Now we learned about the letter Q, letter Q, letter Q, letter Q.
****************************************
Your kids will have a musical blast singing and learning about the letter Q. Learning about the letters in the alphabet and phonics is so much fun for kids!  The Learning Station’s Letter Q Song invites kids to sing, dance and learn about the letters in the alphabet. They will learn the letter Q, how to make the letter Q, sounds the letter Q makes (phonics) and some words beginning with the letter Q.  The Letter Q Song includes lyrics for early readers.

That’s an uppercase Q. That’s an uppercase Q.
Now a lowercase Q, a lowercase Q.
That’s a lowercase Q. That’s a lowercase Q.
Now use your voice. Let’s make the sound of the letter Q.
Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq,  Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq (All together now)
Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq,  Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq Qq 
Now use your eyes to see some words that begin with the letter Q.
Quarter Quail Queen Quilt
Now we learned about the letter Q, letter Q, letter Q, letter Q.
****************************************
Your kids will have a musical blast singing and learning about the letter Q. Learning about the letters in the alphabet and phonics is so much fun for kids!  The Learning Station’s Letter Q Song invites kids to sing, dance and learn about the letters in the alphabet. They will learn the letter Q, how to make the letter Q, sounds the letter Q makes (phonics) and some words beginning with the letter Q.  The Letter Q Song includes lyrics for early readers.

snippet.title: 28 Facts About Hummingbirds - Learn All About Hummingbirds - Animals for Kids - Educational Video
snippet.description:
How does the flight of a hummingbird look like in slow motion? Why can hummingbirds fly sideways and backwards? Do hummingbirds actually use their beak like a straw? Which is the smallest hummingbird species in the world? Do hummingbirds have the fastest wing beat? And do you know which animal is often mistaken for a hummingbird?

Hummingbirds are amazing little birds because they set all kinds of records. The broad-tailed hummingbird lays the smallest eggs in the world, the ruby-throated hummingbird has the fewest feathers of all birds and the blue-throated mountaingem (what a beautiful name!) has the fastest heart beat. That's not nearly all, so just take a look at the video.

In this video you will find interesting facts and information about hummingbirds, for a presentation, a fact file or other homework for school. Don't miss: There is a detailed animal profile on animalfunfacts.net, too!

snippet.title: Smart Video Nanny: A device that will turn the entire education system (machine voice)
snippet.description:
#TheQuantumLeapInEducation #SmartVideoNanny #EducationForNewborns
Please donate
https://www.whydonate.eu/fundraising/smartvideonanny-2nd-generation-more-possibilities-more-features

Thinking about how to give your child the best education in the world, but you don't have enough money?
Smart VideoNanny is the answer to all questions!
Smart VideoNanny is a quantum leap in education!
Smart VideoNanny will make your child a universal genius with almost no investment of money, time, or effort!
So far, this project exists only in my head at the level of an idea. But very soon the first prototypes will appear. Time is accelerating! It's up to us!
What is a regular Video Nanny? It is a simple remote video surveillance camera with additional functions that are used by young parents to monitor their children.
What is Smart Video Nanny? What are its differences?
Smart VideoNanny is a powerful educational platform for babies based on regular VideoNanny!
Smart VideoNanny is the same surveillance camera, to which just a few things have been added:
• Video projector
• Night Sky or home planetarium
• Multilingual analyzer and speech synthesizer with AI (Artificial Intelligence)
• And many others.
That is, this is already the next generation VideoNanny. Which will not only follow the kids but also teach them from birth to 5-6 years!
A bit of theory
Did you know that in newborns, the brain is only 25% of that of an adult, and it is not yet formed? And that its most active growth (more than 60% of the volume) and the formation of a neural network of brain synapses occurs at the earliest age during the first 12 months?
Synaptogenesis is the formation of synapses between neurons in the nervous system. Although it occurs throughout a healthy person's lifespan, an explosion of synapse formation occurs during early brain development, known as exuberant synaptogenesis (From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia)
And in order for the brain to develop harmoniously, and the neural network of synapses to grow as much as possible, it needs information, a lot of information, and the more information there is, the better!
Because information is food for brain development. Without information, the brain starves and remains underdeveloped.
Did you know that cognitive abilities, that is, the ability to absorb Knowledge, are at their maximum in newborns, after which they fall in the opposite exponential manner? As we age, it becomes increasingly difficult for us to memorize and assimilate new material, and our cognitive abilities tend to zero. This can be seen in the example of language learning. Babies do not learn languages — they immediately begin to speak them at the maternal level. How to turn on the bulbs of the Christmas garland, or hang Christmas balls on the Christmas tree
This graph shows that when we go to school, we can assimilate Knowledge 3 times worse than newborns.
And many other reasons convince us that it is necessary to start the education of our babies right from birth, from the very first day of life. And our Smart VideoNanny will help us with this. Therefore, our task as caring parents is to create and launch into mass production the Smart VideoNanny.
Now let's look at exactly how Smart VideoNanny will teach kids.
Today, the usual VideoNanny can sing to babies only a few songs and lullabies in the manufacturer's language.
And if you complicate the task and make the Smart Video Nanny sing songs and lullabies in 20+ languages? After all, then the children will begin to speak fluently in all these 20+ languages at the mother's level! Of course, lullabies alone will not be enough for a confident command of 20+ languages, but the main idea is already clear.
And if you complicate the task even more and add a couple more channels of information? Overlay nature sounds? And then we will immediately receive a huge amount of information:
• Sounds of nature
• Sounds of music
• Quiet human speech
During the first month of newborns, only one channel “works” for receiving information — the auditory channel. Unfortunately, we do not think about it, so most often our kids hear some kind of informational garbage, i.e. frightening and unpleasant sounds from the street, from the TV, from the people around them, and on the basis of all this, their brain is formed.
I propose to sensibly approach the “loading” of this so important auditory channel and surround the baby in the first month of his life with only the most pleasant, harmonious, and soothing sounds. You just need to combine the murmur of water and the singing of birds with the Far Eastern music — and overlay the reading of the "Tao Te Ching" in the original. And all these programs will be formed according to the choice and preferences of the parents.
And so with all 20+ languages. As you can see, it is not difficult, and Smart VideoNanny can easily cope with this task. Thanks to this, his brain will begin to form much more harmoniously, and the baby himself will be calmer.

So far, this project exists only in my head at the level of an idea. But very soon the first prototypes will appear. Time is accelerating! It's up to us!
What is a regular Video Nanny? It is a simple remote video surveillance camera with additional functions that are used by young parents to monitor their children.
What is Smart Video Nanny? What are its differences?
Smart VideoNanny is a powerful educational platform for babies based on regular VideoNanny!
Smart VideoNanny is the same surveillance camera, to which just a few things have been added:
• Video projector
• Night Sky or home planetarium
• Multilingual analyzer and speech synthesizer with AI (Artificial Intelligence)
• And many others.
That is, this is already the next generation VideoNanny. Which will not only follow the kids but also teach them from birth to 5-6 years!
A bit of theory
Did you know that in newborns, the brain is only 25% of that of an adult, and it is not yet formed? And that its most active growth (more than 60% of the volume) and the formation of a neural network of brain synapses occurs at the earliest age during the first 12 months?
Synaptogenesis is the formation of synapses between neurons in the nervous system. Although it occurs throughout a healthy person's lifespan, an explosion of synapse formation occurs during early brain development, known as exuberant synaptogenesis (From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia)
And in order for the brain to develop harmoniously, and the neural network of synapses to grow as much as possible, it needs information, a lot of information, and the more information there is, the better!
Because information is food for brain development. Without information, the brain starves and remains underdeveloped.
Did you know that cognitive abilities, that is, the ability to absorb Knowledge, are at their maximum in newborns, after which they fall in the opposite exponential manner? As we age, it becomes increasingly difficult for us to memorize and assimilate new material, and our cognitive abilities tend to zero. This can be seen in the example of language learning. Babies do not learn languages — they immediately begin to speak them at the maternal level. How to turn on the bulbs of the Christmas garland, or hang Christmas balls on the Christmas tree
This graph shows that when we go to school, we can assimilate Knowledge 3 times worse than newborns.
And many other reasons convince us that it is necessary to start the education of our babies right from birth, from the very first day of life. And our Smart VideoNanny will help us with this. Therefore, our task as caring parents is to create and launch into mass production the Smart VideoNanny.
Now let's look at exactly how Smart VideoNanny will teach kids.
Today, the usual VideoNanny can sing to babies only a few songs and lullabies in the manufacturer's language.
And if you complicate the task and make the Smart Video Nanny sing songs and lullabies in 20+ languages? After all, then the children will begin to speak fluently in all these 20+ languages at the mother's level! Of course, lullabies alone will not be enough for a confident command of 20+ languages, but the main idea is already clear.
And if you complicate the task even more and add a couple more channels of information? Overlay nature sounds? And then we will immediately receive a huge amount of information:
• Sounds of nature
• Sounds of music
• Quiet human speech
During the first month of newborns, only one channel “works” for receiving information — the auditory channel. Unfortunately, we do not think about it, so most often our kids hear some kind of informational garbage, i.e. frightening and unpleasant sounds from the street, from the TV, from the people around them, and on the basis of all this, their brain is formed.
I propose to sensibly approach the “loading” of this so important auditory channel and surround the baby in the first month of his life with only the most pleasant, harmonious, and soothing sounds. You just need to combine the murmur of water and the singing of birds with the Far Eastern music — and overlay the reading of the "Tao Te Ching" in the original. And all these programs will be formed according to the choice and preferences of the parents.
And so with all 20+ languages. As you can see, it is not difficult, and Smart VideoNanny can easily cope with this task. Thanks to this, his brain will begin to form much more harmoniously, and the baby himself will be calmer.
